intro: Synthyris reflexa, commonly known as the reflexed synthyris, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, particularly China and India. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and finely divided leaves. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are arranged in umbels, a common feature in the Apiaceae family. Synthyris reflexa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky areas.
